main event: A round, white object was observed moving erratically from west to east in the southern sky near Camp Springs, Maryland and Fort Belvoir, Virginia on August 2, 1963.
interesting points: The object remained visible for over 10 minutes and had variable speed and intensity.
The object was reported to be at an elevation of 20 degrees in the southern sky.
The report notes that the direction reported as south may have been in error, and the object could have been a balloon.
The report includes measurements of the azimuth and elevation of the object, suggesting an attempt to precisely track its movement.
The sighting was reported by both military and civilian witnesses.
location: Camp Springs, Maryland and Fort Belvoir, Virginia
